transportAdvice: Dublin has a well-developed public transit network including buses, a light rail tram system, and commuter rail lines that connect the city centre to suburbs and tourist areas; the compact city centre is very walkable and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with short daylight hours, typical of a damp Irish winter.
Similar to January, cold and grey with occasional frost and persistent rain.
Early spring brings slightly longer days but still cool temperatures and frequent showers.
Mild and brightening with occasional sunny spells, though showers remain common.
One of the drier and more pleasant months with longer evenings and comfortable temperatures.
Warm and relatively bright with long daylight hours, though rain is still possible.
The warmest month of the year with the best chance of dry, sunny weather.
Still warm and pleasant, though showers begin to increase toward the end of the month.
Early autumn is mild and often enjoyable with a mix of sun and showers.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in, with shorter days.
Cold and frequently rainy with limited daylight, marking the onset of winter.
Cold and wet with the shortest days of the year, though festive atmosphere in the city.
